pullRequest.body:
We show that `H¬π(L_{S/R})` is trivial if `S` is `R`-standard smooth and that `Œ©[S‚ÅÑR]` is free of rank `n` if `S` is `R`-standard smooth of relative dimension `n`.

In particular this shows that standard smooth implies smooth and that standard smooth of relative dimension zero implies smooth and unramified.

---


```suggestion
      (by intro i; simp; intro h; simp [h]) heq2
```

This `simp` seems non-terminal?
Same here.

```suggestion
  cases subsingleton_or_nontrivial S
  ¬∑ exact Module.subsingleton S _
```
These should have lowered priorities

```suggestion
      aeval P.val (pderiv (P.map i) <| c.sum fun i a ‚Ü¶ a * P.relation i) = 0 := by
```

```suggestion
      aeval P.val (c i) ‚Ä¢ (fun j ‚Ü¶ aeval P.val (pderiv (P.map j) (P.relation i))) = 0 := by
```


```suggestion
    have := this c.support (fun i ‚Ü¶ aeval P.val (c i))
```

```suggestion
instance (priority := 900) [IsStandardSmooth R S] : Smooth R S where
  formallySmooth := by
    rw [Algebra.FormallySmooth.iff_subsingleton_and_projective]
    exact ‚ü®inferInstance, inferInstance‚ü©

/-- If `S` is `R`-standard smooth of relative dimension zero, it is √©tale. -/
instance (priority := 900) [IsStandardSmoothOfRelativeDimension 0 R S] : Etale R S where
```
